intro: Wormskioldia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf wormskioldia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves that vary in shape and size, contributing to its common name. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring. Wormskioldia heterophylla is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and drought tolerance.
